DOC.brief_summary: This study do verify whether combination transcutaneous posterior tibial nerve stimulation ( TPTNS ) low dose trospium chloride treatment female overactive bladder ( OAB ) would effective TPTNS alone failure behavioral therapy .
DOC.brief_title: Transcutaneous Posterior Tibial Nerve Electrostimulation With Low Dose Trospium Chloride OAB Females
DOC.detailed_description: The investigator randomize 30 woman OAB , two group : G I ( 15 patient ) receive 30 minute TPTNS , three time week ; GII ( 15 patient ) receive TPTNS plus Low dose trospium chloride ( 20 mg daily ) ; 8 week . Patients evaluate use Overactive Bladder Symptom Score questionnaire ( OABSS ) , Incontinence Impact Questionnaire-short form 7 ( IIQ-7 ) , 3 day void diary urodynamics week 0 8 .
DOC.criteria: Thirty adult female patient OAB symptom ( wet type ) prove detrusor overactivity urodynamics 1 . Patients urinary tract infection bladder outlet obstruction . 2 . Patients neurological disease . 3 . Patients gynecological problem genital infection , pelvic organ prolapse genital tumor . 4 . Patients electronic implant heart pacemaker . 5 . During pregnancy 6 . Patients subject seizure
